reviews.text: Nice Little station with lots of wildlife around it, very nice could do with a few more shelters for the rain however it is very sheltered from the wind good for cheap travel into Temple meads and to Clifton

cheap travel into BTM, one platform so check direction that the train is going in before boarding as trains can be within a few minutes of each other - a bit further away from bus stops if the trains are not running (or indeed rail replacement buses are used), not as convenient as Redland station if you are debating between the 2
Handy local rail station. I once saw a family of badgers playing on the tracks here!

Please, do notice you won't be able to print your tickets here at this station... One day (which was a Monday around 07:15 AM), I travelled to Cardiff from this station and a train inspector asked for my tickets just in the next stop on the way to Bristol Temple Meads... Fortunately, I had printed them beforehand at Bristol Temple Meads the day before only by chance (I was cycling around Bristol Temple Meads then)... Be cautious...
